channel.title: +North on Vishvas's notes
channel.description: Recent content in +North on Vishvas's notes

item.title: Madan Lal Dhingra
item.description: inspired by sAvarkar, assissin of a British officer, a person of strong and firm character (proved by holding his hand over a flame), whose fine speech justified it (" the killing of two millions of people every year and the outraging of our women").

item.title: shyAmji kRShNa varma
item.description: sanskrit scholar, dIvAn of several states, who supported Tilak and chApekar, and strived to ensure Indian independence (W), founded India House where several revolutionaries were incubated.

item.title: sutratrANa khusro khan
item.description:
captured (and possibly castrated) gurjara kShatriya, who unlike malik kafur, turned apostate, captured the throne and briefly stopped the desert madness before death at the hands of Tuglaq, husband of the freed sex slave rANI deval devI [KC AS16]. - “Hence, I, Sultan of the throne, declare that I am no longer a Muslim. I hereby declare that I am a Hindu. I am the Hindu Samrat (Emperor) of India.. Deval Devi, who also was hindu before she was captured and forcibly converted, is my Wife and henceforth be called as empress of India.”
- " Khushrau Khan empties his treasury to pay his Muslim soldiers to defend the city but they decamp after taking the money from him to join the Ghazi. Khusrau is subsequently captured and tortured and killed"
